summary: So Aziraphale and Crowley are cloud gazing right? Pointing out shapes they’re seeing in the clouds.  Aziraphale is describing...
body:
So Aziraphale and Crowley are cloud gazing right? Pointing out shapes they’re seeing in the clouds.  Aziraphale is describing the typical good things he’s seeing, like lambs and rabbits and all that good angel stuff, in his usual adorable excited manner as they lay there in the grass next to each other.

Crowley WANTS to be seeing things like a road kill lamb or a skinned hanging rabbit, but he’d been listening to Aziraphale talk so excitedly that all his shapes have turned to hearts, and when Aziraphale turns to him and asks what he’s seeing Crowley just panics and shouts, “I SEE STABBY STABBY KNIFE THINGS!” and rolls away down the hill.

blog.name: eros-heartache
blog.title: Eros Heartache
blog.description: 100% NOT here for anyone to validate me, Multifandom shitposter, Hedonist/Libertine, random other shit.... Message from Me: You own your shit, you walk your talk. Its fantastic to be loved and happy, but own the knowlege you can and will be a problematic person to someone. You can be hated with validity and with take ownership of your faults. In the end you will never make yourself anything more than the sum of your life, perceptions and expierance. And that wisdom my loves, Is what makes all the diffence.

blog.name: 0-aredhel-0
blog.title: It's peanut butter jelly time!
blog.description:
[COMMISSIONS ARE ON HIATUS] 
--> http://0-aredhel-0.tumblr.com/post/122257624926/open-commisions-you-can-contact-me-via-tumblr

Spanish girl, 28.

DC, Batman, Robin. Dick, as in penis and as in Richard. MARVEL. Avengers. X-MEN. Captain America. Blacksad. 

Tolkien. Harry Potter. Les Misérables. A Song of Ice and Fire. The Outsiders. The Hunger Games. The Princess Bride. The Name of the Wind. The Raven Cycle. Skulduggery Pleasant.

Star Wars. Disney. Ghibli. The Fall. Tim Burton. Pacific Rim. Star Trek. LAIKA. 

Avatar. Steven Universe. Voltron: Legendary Defender. Gravity Falls. Phineas&Ferb. Haikyuu!! DCMK. Digimon. Neon Génesis Evangelion. Over the Garden Wall. Drawn Together. FMA.

Parks & Recreation. Penny Dreadful. Criminal Minds. Firefly. Once Upon a Time. Scrubs. Buffy the Vampire Slayer. Misfits. House MD. FRIENDS. Pushing Daisies. Supernatural. Sherlock. Teen Wolf. Hannibal. Community. Orange is the new black. Brooklyn 99. Wynonna Earp. Sense8. A Series of Unfortunate Events. The Umbrella Academy.

Kingdom Hearts. Final Fantasy VIII. Ace Attorney. Prof. Layton.

GOT7. VIXX. Seventeen. Monsta X.

Hamilton.

Ask me anything! I love talking to you guys C:

summary: Ok so the song “You make me feel like a whore” has such a service!top Crowley vibe to it that I burst out laughing when it came...
body:
Ok so the song “You make me feel like a whore” has such a service!top Crowley vibe to it that I burst out laughing when it came on my playlist while walking to work and got some very very weird looks while I laughed so hard to myself down the street.  I feel a very hilarious fanvideo could be made to that song.

I mean look at the lyrics:


I take your word like it was gospel
I’m so eager to please
Yeah I like it when you talk to me 

It feels so good inside your shadow
(It’s the place I need to be)
Yeah I know I need to climb you
Like a tree

There is this place inside
Where all the good things die
Sometimes I feel like a whore
(Sometimes I feel like a whore) 


I hate the way I am around you
(I’m so nervous and weird)
Sometimes I feel like I’m breathing underwater 

You treat me like I am on fire
Like I’m something to eat
You make me hate what I see When I see me
Yeah I dream of the day
When I learn how to make you pay
Someday I’ll teach you to beg

Someday, someday

Yes I live for the day
When I can hear you say
You make me feel like a whore 


Yes I dream of the time
When I can make you mine
(Maybe then I’ll feel half alive, more alive, so alive)
There is this place inside
Where all the good things die
You make me feel like a whore
body_abstract:
Ok so the song “You make me feel like a whore” has such a service!top Crowley vibe to it that I burst out laughing when it came on my playlist while walking to work and got some very very weird looks while I laughed so hard to myself down the street.  I feel a very hilarious fanvideo could be made to that song.

I mean look at the lyrics:

summary: Crowley loves Aziraphale in flowy skirts, because they're easier to just hike them up or hang out under, but ALSO: Aziraphale in...
question: Crowley loves Aziraphale in flowy skirts, because they're easier to just hike them up or hang out under, but ALSO: Aziraphale in a pencil skirt. Crowley is so weak for those thick thighs and that perfect ass in a pencil skirt. Also a peplum skirt would be just darling!
answer:
okay, first of all, YES, i’m weak for this, i’m so fuckign WEAK

and second, just looked up what a peplum skirt is, aND YES IT WOULD OMG i gotta draw zira in all of these ; w ;

tags: this is as close to canon as its ever going to get and I am TAKING IT
summary: I reached out to ask and Neil Gaiman just confirmed that St Dunstan-in-the-East church garden in the City of London as featured...
body:
I reached out to ask and Neil Gaiman just confirmed that St Dunstan-in-the-East church garden in the City of London as featured my TV!Good Omens headcanon/ficlet The garden in a ruined church DOES have a connection to the location IRL in the realm of him having it in mind! Douglas Mackinnon (the Director) explains that the exterior was shot in South Africa, hence why the architecture doesn’t match the actual ruins in London.

So for everyone who has reblogged and tagged (I see you! bless and thanks, these responses give me life) my hc as a Good Omens-specific place, travel bucket list destination, or similar, and want to keep it in your heart (or maybe even visit it, if you can) as a special IRL place that means something to our ineffable husbands…well this is as close to official confirmation as we’ll get, so headcanon it as much as you’d like!

For the curious, I originally made a guess at the St. Dunstans relation by reverse engineering the position of the monuments in the background with the help of @amuseoffyre​‘s post and comparing it to old maps of the City of London to make a calculated guess.

Douglas Mackinnon (the Director) explains that the exterior was shot in South Africa, hence why the architecture doesn’t match the actual ruins in London.

So for everyone who has reblogged and tagged (I see you! bless and thanks, these responses give me life) my hc as a Good Omens-specific place, travel bucket list destination, or similar, and want to keep it in your heart (or maybe even visit it, if you can) as a special IRL place that means something to our ineffable husbands…well this is as close to official confirmation as we’ll get, so headcanon it as much as you’d like!

Douglas Mackinnon (the Director) explains that the exterior was shot in South Africa, hence why the architecture doesn’t match the actual ruins in London.

So for everyone who has reblogged and tagged (I see you! bless and thanks, these responses give me life) my hc as a Good Omens-specific place, travel bucket list destination, or similar, and want to keep it in your heart (or maybe even visit it, if you can) as a special IRL place that means something to our ineffable husbands…well this is as close to official confirmation as we’ll get, so headcanon it as much as you’d like!

I reached out to ask and Neil Gaiman just confirmed that St Dunstan-in-the-East church garden in the City of London as featured my TV!Good Omens headcanon/ficlet The garden in a ruined church DOES have a connection to the location IRL in the realm of him having it in mind! Douglas Mackinnon (the Director) explains that the exterior was shot in South Africa, hence why the architecture doesn’t match the actual ruins in London.

So for everyone who has reblogged and tagged (I see you! bless and thanks, these responses give me life) my hc as a Good Omens-specific place, travel bucket list destination, or similar, and want to keep it in your heart (or maybe even visit it, if you can) as a special IRL place that means something to our ineffable husbands…well this is as close to official confirmation as we’ll get, so headcanon it as much as you’d like!

For the curious, I originally made a guess at the St. Dunstans relation by reverse engineering the position of the monuments in the background with the help of @amuseoffyre​‘s post and comparing it to old maps of the City of London to make a calculated guess.

summary:
Here's my interpretation of the line "Still a demon?" from episode 3.
At this point, Aziraphale and Crowley have been at least...
body:
Here’s my interpretation of the line “Still a demon?” from episode 3.

At this point, Aziraphale and Crowley have been at least friends for a while and the angel knows that he is not inherently bad. Of course he does his job as comanded but Aziraphele sees how this supposedly being of absolute darkness, hates his job and the most the wicked thing he’s seen him done is to mildly inconvenient/annoy humans.

He still believes that everything is right or wrong without any gray areas, so he hopes Crowley will become an angel again, that he can be forgiven. That’s also why he’s so insistent throughout the series of forgiving him. Because is his most desperate attempt of saving him before Armageddon and before they would need to be separated.

title: let us cling together - brinnanza - Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Title: let us cling together

Fandom: Good Omens

Pairing: Aziraphale/Crowley

Rating: G

Word Count: 692

Summary:  He finds Crowley in bed, asleep even at this late hour. It’s hardly much of a lie in for a being who’d once slept through most of a century, though perhaps quite an extended one for a being who doesn’t really need to sleep at all.

summary: you know the other thing that I really enjoy about Good Omens? Despite being messy af and bad at talking about their feelings...
body: you know the other thing that I really enjoy about Good Omens? Despite being messy af and bad at talking about their feelings and using their words, Crowley and Aziraphale are just like… actual grown-ups. Like, their defining character traits are that that they would risk literally everything to avoid a change in their daily routine. They literally defy Heaven and face down Satan to stop the Apocalypse because after a long day they just want to unwind at home with their significant other and a nice glass of red. Like they are SO decidedly middle-aged that actual paradise to these two immortal beings of immense otherworldly power is an early dinner out with your sweetie at your favorite restaurant and then going DIRECTLY home to open a bottle of wine and throw on your favorite album. and honestly, hard same?
